channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC

item.title: Report E-2025020211
item.description:
Report E-2025020211

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: WELLFORD
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 7:40 AM ET, NGV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Wellford, SC. The spill consists of approximately 5 gallons of battery acid, which released from 1–2500-pound battery due to the shipper loading the battery onto a pallet that was not sturdy enough to hold it in place, causing it to fall off the pallet after unloading and spilling onto the dock floor. The terminal stated they will clean the spill with absorbents, and they will place the waste into 1–10-gallon poly drum, and the battery will be shrink wrapped onto the pallet. This did move on to the customer.

item.title: Report E-2025020188
item.description:
Report E-2025020188

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: MANNING
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver had a spill of approximately 10 gallons of diesel or less. Driver attempted to clean it up but did not report as required. Investigation determined that he failed to properly lock the fitting down, did not properly cleanup the spill, and did not properly report as required per company policy. CDG was contacted to manage the cleanup and sent a contractor onsite. They cleaned the concrete with absorbents and swept them into drums. Product did not reach drains, grass, or stormwater.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver overfilled tank and resulted in a release of approximately 10 gallons of diesel. No drains were impacted. CDG managed the response cleanup. Vendor used Oil Dri on the impacted area.
